nlmInfo.value: The Schrödinger model uses 3 quantum numbers ({{n}},{{l}},{{m}}) to describe the most probable location of an electron, also known as an orbital.

nInfo.value: {{n}}, the Principal Quantum Number, describes the electron's energy and its probable distance from the nucleus.

lInfo.value: {{l}}, the Angular Quantum Number, describes the shape of the orbital. Orbital shapes are spherical ({{l}} = 0 or {{s}}), peanut-shaped ({{l}} = 1 or {{p}}), and become more complex as {{l}} increases.

mInfo.value: {{m}}, the Magnetic Quantum Number, describes the orientation of the orbital in space.

experimentOopsDialogMessage.value: The electron is stuck in an excited state. Resetting the electron.

accessibleHelpText.value: Show table of electron state transitions and their associated wavelengths.
Use buttons to set the light source to a specific wavelength.
Choose wave representation for de Broglie model.
Observe changes in electron’s state as shown in an energy level diagram.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Explore electron transitions and relate observations to quantum models of the hydrogen atom.

playArea.value: The Play Area contains a light source aimed at a sample of hydrogen atoms. The observation window displays a zoomed-in view of a single atom, which varies with the mode of exploration. In Experiment mode, the atom’s structure is a mystery and is obscured. In Model mode, there are various quantum models of the hydrogen atom to explore. Determine the structure of the hydrogen atom by shining white or monochromatic light on the sample. Observe changes in the electron’s state in the Electron Energy Level diagram.

controlArea.value: The Control Area has a Spectrometer that displays a histogram of the photons emitted by the hydrogen atom. Take snapshots of the spectrometer to compare data. Use Time Controls to adjust how fast the action happens in the observation window, including buttons to pause and step forward. Reset the sim to start over.

interactionHint.value: Turn on light source to start exploring.

accessibleHelpText.value: Collect experimental data or explore atomic models.
Choose type of light emitted by light source.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Compare experimental spectroscopy data to historical models of the hydrogen atom.

playArea.value: The Play Area contains a light source aimed at a sample of hydrogen atoms. The observation window displays a zoomed-in view of a single atom which varies with the mode of exploration. In Experiment mode, the atom’s structure is a mystery and is obscured. In Model mode, there are various models of the hydrogen atom to explore, ranging from classical to quantum. Determine the structure of the hydrogen atom by shining white or monochromatic light on the sample.

controlArea.value: The Control Area has a Spectrometer that displays a histogram of the photons emitted by the hydrogen atom. Take snapshots of the spectrometer to compare data. Use Time Controls to adjust how fast the action happens in the observation window, including buttons to pause and step forward. Reset the sim to start over.

interactionHint.value: Turn on light source to start exploring.

accessibleHelpText.value: Take up to {{max}} snapshots of spectrometer data.
Adjust wavelength for monochromatic light source.
